alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 26 at 2:26AM CDT until October 26 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Kimble County in west central Texas... * Until 530 AM CDT. * At 224 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Rain gauge reports and radar indicate that 1 to 1 and a half inches of rain has fallen in the past hour on top of already saturated soils from earlier heavy rain. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junction, South Llano River State Park, Segovia, Yates Crossing, Telegraph, London, Cleo, Us-83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 438 and 473. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Park Road 73 crossing South Llano River, US HWY 377 crossing South Llano River, FM 2169 crossing Johnson Fork Creek, RM 2291 crossings along Bear Creek, US HWY 377 crossing 2 miles North of Telegraph, County Road 430 crossing Johnson Fork, Old Segovia Rd. crossing Johnson Fork, KC 451 crossing Johnson Fork, crossings along County Road 410 and KC 314 crossing Llano River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
